title: Set up external access for Snowflake Notebooks | Snowflake Documentation
paragraphs: Feature — Generally Available
Generally available in Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, and Google Cloud Platform (GCP) commercial regions.

By default, Snowflake restricts network traffic requests from external endpoints. In order to access external endpoints, you need to create
an external network access integration. This topic describes
how you can set up external network access for your notebook.
External access integrations and their underlying network rules must be created by an organization administrator.
To create an external access integration for notebooks, do the following:
Create a network rule that defines a set of IP addresses or domains using the CREATE NETWORK RULE command.
Create an external access integration that specifies the list of allowed network rules using the CREATE EXTERNAL ACCESS INTEGRATION command.
Note

Only an ACCOUNTADMIN or a role with the privilege to create EAIs can set them up for specific external endpoints. For information on
the required privileges, see Access control requirements.
The following examples show how to set up external access for common data science and machine learning sites.

Allow all network access with one external access integration:
After you create the EAIs, you must grant the USAGE privilege on the integration to an account role.

The role used to create an EAI becomes the owner. As the owner, the role is required to grant the USAGE privilege to
other roles. To grant USAGE privileges on the integrations, use the following commands:
Note

It is important to grant the USAGE privilege on the integration to the role that creates the notebooks. USAGE granted to the PUBLIC role
will not work. For detailed syntax, see external network access.

After you create and provision EAIs, make sure to restart the notebook session in order to see the access integrations you created in
the external access pane.
Sign in to Snowsight.
Select Projects » Notebooks.
To access the external access configuration, select the  on the top right of your notebook.
Select Notebook settings, and then select the External access pane.

In the list of external access integrations that are available, select the toggles next to each integration to
enable or disable them.
To enable the new integrations, see Enable external access integrations (EAI).

In most cases, APIs require an API key. To allow external access, use SQL to associate a secret (such as the API key) with your notebook.
To manually associate a secret with a notebook, use the ALTER NOTEBOOK … SET SECRETS command:
To retrieve a secret after associating it with a notebook, see Python API for Secret Access.
For detailed syntax, see External network access overview.

For additional examples of EAIs, see External network access examples or
Setting up External Access for Snowflake Notebooks on Github.
